newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Southeast power flat despite Fla. nuke outage.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Southeast power flat despite Fla. nuke outage.

text.p: Spot bulk electricity values in the southeastern U.S. finished flat on Tuesday against Monday's level despite outage at another nuclear generating station in Florida, industry sources said.
Mild autumn weather in Florida offset concerns over further reduction in production capacity in the Southeastern Electric Reliability Council (SERC), marketers said.
"The weather is more than compensating for a reduction in generation," a Florida utility trader said.
Temperatures in Florida for Wednesay were forecast to peak in the low- to high-80s Fahrenheit, while the rest of the Southeast were predicted to hit highs in the low-70s to low-80s.
Florida Power & Light Co said it aimed to restart the 666 megawatt (MW) Turkey Point 4 nuclear unit late Wednesday. The Florida City, Fla., plant was shut on Monday to repair a feedwater heater.
Florida Power Corp said it still did not have a restart date of its 860 MW Crystal River nuclear power plant in Red Level, Fla.

In addition to those Florida nuclear stations, four other facilities, with combined capacity of 5,275 MW, in the SERC district remained shut for repairs or refueling: 1,148 MW Sequoyah 2 nuclear plant in Soddy-Daisy, Tenn.; 822 MW Farley 2 in Dothan, Ala.; 767 MW Brunswick 1 in Southport, N.C. and the 2,538 MW Oconee complex in Seneca, S.C.
Virginia Power Co's 909 MW North Anna 2 nuclear plant in Mineral, Va., was shut on Monday for repairs, and expected to return some time on Thursday.
At the Georgia/Florida border, firm, peak electricity for Tuesday was again quoted at $21.00-$23.50 a megawatt hour.
Firm, off-peak electricity for next-day delivery was still valued at $15.00-$16.00.
Hourly economic dispatch on Tuesday available to Florida utilities was heard near $17.00.
Up in the northern portion of Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) system, firm, peak electricity was assessed at $17.00-$18.00, flat from Monday.
Off-peak, firm power in northern TVA for Tuesday delivery was mostly pegged near $12.00, unchanged from Monday's quote.
For a second day, the TVA did not offer its own generation for next-day sale, according to market sources.
